clues.text: Say the name of this "ghost with the most" 3 times & he'll show up to exorcise the living

Jake & Elwood call Sister Mary Stigmata "the penguin" in this 1980 film; she beats them with a stick
As Mother Superior in this film, Maggie Smith tells Whoopi, "People wish to kill you. Anyone who's met you, I imagine"
Being grilled by this Oscar winner in "Doubt", Philip Seymour Hoffman says, "I object to your tone"
In "Change of Habit", Mary Tyler Moore clashes with a local priest & falls for this rocker
Jack Black is sweet on Sister Encarnacion in this 2006 movie; she's mad that kids are "wrestling in a sacred place"

Short ends of grain after harvesting, or of hair before shaving

Each year the Horror Writers Association presents awards named in honor of this "Dracula" author
This medal awarded to African Americans for outstanding achievement is named for an early NAACP chairman
Established in 1348, this oldest & highest order of British knighthood is named for a fashion accessory

As the old saying goes, this city "wasn't built in a day"

A bobblehead of this chocolatier & philanthropist--cool giveaway from a Lancaster Barnstormers game
A bumbershoot is one of these; Mary Poppins made a memorable entrance using one
Mx. is a title that you can use when referring to someone when you don't know this about them

A woodpusher is a weak player of this game
Snickersnee refers to one of these; in "Jabberwocky", one went "snicker-snack"

Completes the title of David Lagercrantz' book that continued Stieg Larsson's series, "The Girl in..."

Prolific Brandon Sanderson put more on his plate, helping Robert Jordan finish the fantasy series "The Wheel of" this

This western U.S. city has a museum featuring a "neon boneyard", an outdoor exhibit of old signs dating back to the 1930s
The first neon sign in this London "Circus" advertised Bovril, a beef gloop the British love
George Benson reminded us in song that "they say the neon lights are bright on" this thoroughfare

rounds.text: It dates back to the "French Blue", which was set in gold & suspended from a neck ribbon when Louis XIV wore it on ceremonial occasions
